intro: Bonania cubana subsp. cubana, commonly known as the Cuban bonania, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly Cuba. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant has opposite, simple leaves that are often elliptical in shape and have a glossy surface. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
